page.title: 02Two Symbols Of Linlithgow
page.content:
The Black Bitch Linlithgow has two coats of arms.The main one is St Michael's and the Black Bitch is the second one.The Black Bitch pub was built in 1253 at the West Port.The Black Bitch coat of arms was used as Linlithgow's symbol from the 17th century.The symbol shows a black dog and a tree and suggests that Linlithgow was a good place for hunting.
Katie Wearie's Tree Katie Wearie's Tree is situated just beside Billy Gray's grocer's shop at the West Port.It was called Katie Wearie's Tree because she used to wait there on her way to market each morning.The original tree was 70 years old and it blew down in 1910.The new tree was planted in 1983.
